revised_title: The Morphological Affinity of Tmesipteris with the Sphenophyllales
tldr: The author examines the variations in the fertile structures of Tmesipteris and its morphological relationship with the Sphenophyllales. They find that Tmesipteris shares several characteristics with the extinct Sphenophyllales, such as dichotomous division of leaves, sporophylls more elaborate than vegetative leaves, multiple synangia on a single sporophyll, and the presence of a special ventral lobe of the leaf as a sporangiophore.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
